results.title: Yehinat fekir
results.brief_description: ‘Yehinat fekir’ means a mother’s love. I was born in Sudan and this is my story about my mother and how she struggled to bring us to Australia.

results.title: Family tree
results.creator_credit: Norman Bailey, Wolf Koenig, Andy Thomson and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “A Discussion in bioethics”.
One of a series of short, open-ended dramas designed to stimulate discussion of values and ethics in relation to modern medical technology. This film examines the moral questions surrounding the issue of compulsory sterilization. When a child-beater and single mother of three is admitted to hospital in need of abdominal surgery, the surgeon is sorely tempted to perform a tubal ligation without the patient’s consent, thus preventing the birth of “new victims.”
results.creator_credit_for_label: Norman Bailey, Wolf Koenig, Andy Thomson and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: The Crow
results.creator_credit: Alex Proyas, Jeff Most, Edward Pressman and Crowvision
results.brief_description: There is a legend that when a soul can’t rest, a crow can bring that soul back form the dead, to seek justice and make the wrongs thins right.. In the film which cost him his life, martial arts phenomenon Brandon Lee stars as a superhuman mystical hero who returns from the grave to exact revenge on the killers of his fiancee and himself. The film contains fantastic special effects, awesome action and a dark, cyberpunk setting. Lee was killed on the set accidentally in a manner similar to his father, martial arts legend Bruce Lee, so a stand-in was used to complete the filming.

results.title: Sunshine and shadow
results.creator_credit: Ric Burns, Lisa Ades, New York Historical Society, WNET (Television station : New York, N.Y.), Thirteen, WGBH (Boston) and Steeplechase Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “New York: a documentary film”.
Episode 3: SUNSHINE AND SHADOW (1865-1898) charts New York’s history during the decades following the Civil War when it continued to grow demographically, geographically and financially at a staggering rate. It explores the incomparable fortunes of the robber barons at the unabashed corruption of political leaders in an era when the expansion of both wealth and poverty- and the schism between them- built to a complex. The episode ends with the consolidation of the five boroughs to form Greater New York on January 1, 1898. Narrated by David Ogden Stiers.

results.title: Critical choice
results.creator_credit: Gary Toole, Wolf Koenig, Andy Thomson and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “A Discussion in bioethics”.
One of a series of short, open-ended dramas designed to stimulate discussion of values and ethics in relation to modern medical technology. The film considers the cost of high-risk organ transplants and the allocation of scarce medical resources. A child is in need of a liver transplant. The child has only a 40% chance of surviving with the transplant, but a 100% chance of dying without it. How should society’s limited medical dollars be spent?
results.creator_credit_for_label: Gary Toole, Wolf Koenig, Andy Thomson and National Film Board of Canada

results.creator_credit: Justin Milne, Newfilms and South Australian Film Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Horses: basics to eventing”.
Part of the “Horses: basics to eventing” series, this films shows the horse being prepared for floating, walking the course and completing the cross country course.
